column4: no, if it does that it probably means the drive cant read/identify the media
the media is probably incompatible
Why would it be? It's DVD-R
you want to burn a dvd image right?
Yeah, I got this shiny Windows 7 ISO sitting here
try sudo cdrecord dev=/dev/sr0 /path/to/file.iso
if you have multiple drives try sr1 and so on to find the dvd burner
If I'm getting the ISO from a Windows share, what's the file path?
you have to mount the share or copy it local first
It's mounted.
It's mounted!
did you use the connect to server thing? then its not mounted
Then why is there an unmount option?
i highly recommend putting it localy first, network problems might screw your burn
No network problems ...
it basicaly doesnt make a difference, the burning program needs to transfer the whole file anyways..
I'll find you and murder you if this doesn't work.
It still remains that Ubuntu isn't seeming to detect my DVD ..
thats why i told you to use cdrecord
How would cdrecord fix that?
you have to point it at the correct drive, so it eliminates possible problems in detecting the right devicenode to use and stuff
and it will mostlikely tell you why it doesnt work if it doesnt
yeah?
Caught you in Windows.
